snippet: The photographer Andrew Moore answers questions about how he photographed the middle of America from above.
abstract: The photographer Andrew Moore answers questions about how he photographed the middle of America from above.
lead_paragraph: For the last seven years, Andrew Moore has been traveling to the northern Great Plains to photograph the land and the people who live there. In this week’s edition of the magazine, we feature several of Moore’s pictures from this project, which he has titled “Dirt Meridian.” You can see how he made the pictures in this video. What follows is a condensed version of a conversation we had recently about the project.

headline.main: Capturing of the Country From the Strut of a Plane
